keyword: how many calories are in reeses peanut butter cups
title: How Many Calories Are in Reese's Peanut Butter Cups?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in Reese's Peanut Butter Cups, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and serving tips for this classic candy.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Reese's Peanut Butter Cups?
assumptions: Standard size milk chocolate Reese's Peanut Butter Cup (~17 g), peanut butter filling, no modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by exact size, batch, and manufacturer; values based on standard Hershey's data. Check packaging for precise info.

quick_answer.text: One standard Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 105 calories, mostly from fat and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mini Reese's Peanut Butter Cup (smaller size)
King size Reese's Peanut Butter Cup (larger portion)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one Reese's Peanut Butter Cup?
faqs.a: About 105 calories for a standard size cup.

faqs.q: What are the macros in Reese's Peanut Butter Cups?
faqs.a: Per cup: 7 g fat, 10 g carbs (9 g sugars), 2 g protein.

faqs.q: Do Reese's Peanut Butter Cups have cholesterol?
faqs.a: No cholesterol (0 mg) per cup, as they're dairy-free in that aspect.

faqs.q: How many calories in a pack of Reese's Peanut Butter Cups?
faqs.a: A standard pack of two cups has about 210 calories.

faqs.q: Are Reese's Peanut Butter Cups high in sodium?
faqs.a: Moderately, with 85 mg sodium per cup from the peanut butter and chocolate.
